1516541399_1FFFPdGUQvWPFf4cxmqrGwdKgra3E.body:
Correct me if I'm wrong but just like regular Bittorrent, the peers IP's are not something "secret", you can yourself get a list of the peers you're talking to here : http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats

These are not linked to a ZeroID though.

> [strange](#comment_1_1FFFPdGUQvWPFf4cxmqrGwdKgra3Eu4UhM): Okif zeroid can't see the ip of the bad actor, how can fight spam? this isn't clear to me

Which spam are you referring to ?

In any case, I do think it's ZeroID's job to censor/ban users (that's a concern but the same concern exist on every decentralized network by design)

Also, you can mute users on ZeroID page, never used the feature myself so I don't know it it would help you.

1528428020_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: You could already do that now by having your ZeroNet data directory mounted as "tmpfs" (aka RAM disk)
